tasks: Create a low-fidelity wireframe of a product feature using only the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design (nngroup.com). Focus on applying Tesler’s Law to improve usability.
Write down 5 common errors in UI Craft & Visual Design and brainstorm ways to mitigate them. Refer to Hick’s Law and Aesthetic-Usability Effect for inspiration.
Design a simple, high-contrast color scheme using the 8-point grid system. Apply this design principle to your own portfolio's navigation.
Conduct a user interview and document 3 pain points using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework. Focus on understanding the motivations behind users' behaviors.
Create a mind map of product thinking & strategy concepts, highlighting key differences between them. Use Tesler’s Law to inform your approach.
Redesign a simple product feature (e.g., a login form) using UI Craft & Visual Design principles, focusing on error states and feedback mechanisms.
Develop a user research plan for a new product feature. Apply the 10 Usability Heuristics to ensure usability.
Create a visual design system for a fictional company, incorporating Tesler’s Law and Hick’s Law into your design decisions.
Write a short article (approx. 500 words) on the importance of collaboration & communication in UX design, referencing specific examples from your own experience.
Design a comprehensive usability testing plan for a new product feature. Apply the Jobs-to-be-Done framework to understand user motivations.
Develop a case study of a successful UX design project, highlighting key takeaways and lessons learned. Use Tesler’s Law to inform your approach.
Create a capstone project: redesign a existing product or service using UI Craft & Visual Design principles, focusing on error states and feedback mechanisms.

resources.readup: As an emerging senior UX designer, you have a solid foundation in user research and validation, allowing you to craft intuitive and user-centered designs. Focus on building upon your strengths in UI Craft & Visual Design and Product Thinking & Strategy to elevate your portfolio and take on more complex projects.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Understanding Hick’s Law and its Impact on UX Design
topics.summary: As an Emerging Senior, mastering Hick’s Law will help you optimize navigation and reduce cognitive load in your designs.
practice_points: Create a usability test with 3-5 participants to demonstrate the impact of Hick’s Law on real-world interactions (deliverable: video analysis and written report)
Design a new navigation system for an existing website or app, incorporating Hick’s Law principles to reduce cognitive load
Develop a heuristic evaluation checklist based on Hick’s Law to ensure consistency in your design reviews

topics.name: Crafting Effective Micro-Interactions using Aesthetic-Usability Effect
topics.summary: By applying the Aesthetic-Usability Effect, you can create engaging and intuitive micro-interactions that enhance user experience.
practice_points: Create 3 interactive prototypes in Figma with micro-interactions using the Aesthetic-Usability Effect (deliverable: video walkthrough of each prototype)
Conduct a usability test to evaluate the effectiveness of micro-interactions on user behavior and engagement
Design a new feature or button that incorporates the Aesthetic-Usability Effect to improve user experience

topics.name: Applying Tesler’s Law for Consistent Navigation
topics.summary: By understanding and applying Tesler’s Law, you can create consistent navigation patterns that reduce cognitive load and improve user trust.
practice_points: Analyze an existing website or app to identify areas where Tesler’s Law is not being applied (deliverable: written report with recommendations)
Design a new navigation system for a hypothetical project, incorporating Tesler’s Law principles to ensure consistency
Develop a set of guidelines for consistent navigation patterns in your design process
